channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Objects in River Chelt, 30th September
item.description:
See photo. Some sort of road works barrier and a metal barrel are in the river. Potentially blocking flow of water. Just to west side of the footbridge going to Arle Avenue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Mill House Rear Of Arle Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electric fence and overgrown gate, 29th September
item.description:
Electric fence and overgrown gate joing path to path
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown bush blocking view out of junction, 29th September
item.description:
Difficult to see out of the junction from Hartley Lane onto Leckhampton Hill Road. This has the potential to cause a nasty accident as you have to edge out into the main road to be able to view up the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Firsbrake Hartley Lane, Leckhampton Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Harsh Speedhumps, Potholes and Poor repairs, 29th September
item.description:
The road is in a massive state. The speed humps are too aggressive and like driving over curbs. I understand the need but I think that islands would be better suited. Travelling along this road every day is causing excessive wear to the cars suspension. If its not the speed humps causing damage its the potholes or poor workmanship repairing them. This has been an ongoing problem for many many months now!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 101 Caernarvon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 Vans Parking Outside our House stopping Us being able to park outside our home, 29th September
item.description:
It’s Been Happening For About 5 Months There Blocking the view of the round and parking on The corner Which Is Dangerous For Everyone Who Uses The Road, We Also Find Ourselves And Our Neighbours Can’t Park Outside Our House Because They Take Up So Much Space And They Dont Live On Our Road, when Asking Them To Park Else Where Theyve Been Rude
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 55 Thompson Way, Innsworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped empty beer bottles/ cans, 29th September
item.description:
By the rock area, and seated area before you exit Symphony Road via the footpath there are broken beer bottles, cans and rubbish dumped. It’s getting really tiresome in the area for cannabis smoking, drinking in the day, graffiti and now they appear to be dumping and leaving their glass bottles. Small children play and explore in this area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): South Grove Cold Pool Lane, Up Hatherley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branches and leaves, 29th September
item.description:
We have a number of horse chestnut trees in the road and as it’s cocker season people have been looking to knock these off and with the wind this has caused a mess on the the road Griffiths Avenue and I think it needs cleaning up …it is very slippery with everything broken on the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Goldfoot House Griffiths Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dangerous footpath bridge over Tirle Brook, Woolstone, 27th September
item.description:
Very dangerous footpath bridge over Tirle Brook on S.W. edge of Grange Farm, Woolstone. For several months one of the planks of this bridge was rotted and fallen through leaving a gap of about 20cm. Now more planks are rotted and gone, leaving a gap of about 2' (60 cm). This is exceedingly dangerous, due to the depth of the brook, and this bridge is the access to two footpaths to Oxenton. A repair is badly needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Grange Farm Woolstone Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pelican crossing lights damaged Swindon Rd Cheltenham, 26th September
item.description:
The pelican crossing lights outside university of Gloucestershire Francis Close Hall campus on Swindon Road have been damaged. The lights are all facing the wrong direction by about 90 degrees - this means that drivers travelling eastbound along Swindon Road don’t see the traffic signal at all. The bottom bracket connecting the lights unit to the pole is no longer attached. Number on the pole is 1

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Caledonian Inn, 60 Swindon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
